<table bgColor="#ffffff" border="0" width="100%"> <tbody> <tr> <td align="left" cellpadding="10"> <a href="index.html"><img border="0" alt="Basic Brain, Shaded: X3D Specification Volume Visualization example" title="Basic Brain, Shaded: X3D Specification Volume Visualization example" hspace="10" src="Brain_Basic_Shaded.png" width="200" height="88" align="left"/></a> </td> <td> <p> The X3D Volume Rendering component represents a 3D portion of space with a renderable grid of voxel values for advanced visualization and presentation techniques. </p> <p> The Volume Rendering examples illustrate concepts and capabilities defined by the X3D version&nbsp;3.3 ISO specification for <a href="https://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/volume.html" target="_blank">X3D Volume Rendering Component</a>, produced by the <a href="https://www.web3d.org/realtime-3d/working-groups/medx3d" target="_blank">Web3D Medical Working Group</a>. </p> <p> Volume data is typically encoded in the <a href="http://teem.sourceforge.net/nrrd" target="_blank">NRRD (Nearly Raw Raster Data)</a> format. Further information is found in this archive's <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Basic/VolumeRendering/README.txt" target="_blank">README</a> file. See <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Basic/VolumeRendering/build.xml" target="_blank">build.xml</a> for <a href="https://savage.nps.edu/Savage/VolumeRendering/datasets/nrrd/datasets.zip" target="_blank">datasets.zip</a> download support. </p> </td> <td align="right" cellpadding="10"> <a href="http://teem.sourceforge.net/nrrd" target="_blank"><img border="0" alt="NRRD (Nearly Raw Raster Data)" title="NRRD (Nearly Raw Raster Data)" hspace="10" src="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Basic/VolumeRendering/nrrd256.jpg" width="120" height="120" align="left"/></a> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table>
